### Vehicle Equipment Installation/Removal Services - Nova Scotia

#### Request for Standing Offer (RSO)

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) in Nova Scotia are seeking a contractor to provide vehicle equipment installation and removal services on a "as and when" requested basis. This service is required to support the RCMP's fleet operations in the Halifax Regional Municipality area.

#### In-Scope Requirements
- The contractor will be responsible for installing and removing police emergency equipment, safety equipment, and radio/communication equipment on RCMP vehicles.
- A minimum of 50 RCMP vehicles must be able to be stored at the contractor's installation facility within a 20-kilometer radius of the Halifax Regional Municipality.
- Storage needs will fluctuate, and an agreement for the required capacity must be part of the contractor's proposal.

#### Preferred Requirements
- The contractor is required to provide an unsupervised outdoor storage compound capable of storing at least 50 RCMP vehicles.
- The storage facility should be easily accessible, well-lit, and protected from the elements to ensure the security and preservation of the equipment.

#### Evaluation Criteria
- Capacity to perform services.
- Turnaround time for delivering services.
- Storage availability.
- Lowest evaluated price.

#### Standing Offer Period
- The standing offer will be valid for 12 months, with 3 additional 12-month options to extend.
- A total of 300 vehicles are expected to be involved in this service, with 150 vehicles to be equipped per 12-month period and 150 vehicles to be de-equipped over the same period.

#### Notice Posting
This notice was posted on the CanadaTenders website on 2024-03-27 and is currently listed under Opportunity Title: Vehicle Equipment Installation/Removal Services – NS.
